labels.analysis: The VLM Run MCP Server appears to be focused on API integration, allowing users to interact with the VLM Run API platform. Its core functionality involves managing and processing API requests efficiently, which suggests it is primarily a bridge between user applications and the VLM Run platform. The MCP Inspector tool further indicates a focus on testing and debugging API interactions, ensuring optimal performance. The only available tool mentioned (Optional Settings) relates to server management, which may involve authentication for accessing the API.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "API Integration" was chosen because the server's core function revolves around interacting with the VLM Run API. The secondary label "Development Tools" is included because of the debugging and testing capabilities offered by the MCP Inspector. This aligns with the server's role in enhancing application capabilities through API interactions and ensuring smooth integration.

server_info_crawled.name: VLM Run MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @vlm-run/vlmrun-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Facilitate seamless interaction with the VLM Run API platform. Manage and process requests efficiently to enhance your applications' capabilities. Utilize the MCP Inspector for testing and debugging to ensure optimal performance.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@vlm-run/vlmrun-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: apiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: VLM Run API key, alternatively set via env var VLMRUN_API_KEY.
